==Events==
* [[221]] &ndash; [[Roman Emperor]] [[Elagabalus]] adopts his cousin [[Alexander Severus]] as his heir and receives the title of [[Caesar (title)|Caesar]].
* [[363]] &ndash; [[Roman Emperor]] [[Julian the Apostate|Julian]] is killed during the retreat from the [[Sassanid Empire]]. General [[Jovian (Emperor)|Jovian]] is proclaimed Emperor by the troops on the battlefield.
* [[699]] &ndash; [[En no Ozuno]], a Japanese mystic and apothecary who will later be regarded as the founder of a folk religion [[Shugendō]], is banished to [[Izu Ōshima]].
*[[1409]] &ndash; [[Western Schism]]: The [[Roman Catholic church]] is led into a double [[schism (religion)|schism]] as Petros Philargos is crowned [[Pope Alexander V]] after the [[Council of Pisa]], joining [[Pope Gregory XII]] in Rome and [[Pope Benedict XII]] in [[Avignon]].
*[[1541]] &ndash; [[Francisco Pizarro]] is [[assassinated]] in [[Lima]] by the son of his former companion and later [[antagonist]], [[Diego Almagro]] the younger. Almagro is later caught and executed.
*[[1718]] &ndash; [[Tsarevich Alexei Petrovich of Russia]], [[Peter I of Russia|Peter the Great's]] son, mysteriously dies after being sentenced to death by his father for plotting against him.
*[[1723]] &ndash; After a siege and bombardment by cannon, [[Baku]] surrenders to the [[Russians]].
*[[1740]] &ndash; A combined force Spanish, free blacks and allied Indians defeat a British garrison at the [[Siege of Fort Mose]] near [[St. Augustine, Florida|St. Augustine]] during the [[War of Jenkins' Ear]].
*[[1848]] &ndash; End of the [[June Days Uprising]] in Paris.
*[[1857]] &ndash; The first investiture of the [[Victoria Cross]] in [[Hyde Park, London|Hyde Park]], London.
*[[1870]] &ndash; The [[Christian]] holiday of [[Christmas]] is declared a [[federal holiday]] in the United States.
*[[1886]] &ndash; [[Henri Moissan]] isolated elemental [[Fluorine]] for the first time.
*[[1889]] &ndash; [[Bangui]] is founded by Albert Dolisie and Alfred Uzac in what was then the upper reaches of the [[French Congo]].
*[[1906]] &ndash; [[1906 French Grand Prix]], the first Grand Prix motor racing event held
*[[1907]] &ndash; The [[1907 Tiflis bank robbery]] took place in Yerevan Square, now [[Freedom Square, Tbilisi]].
*[[1909]] &ndash; The [[Science Museum (London)|Science Museum]] in London comes into existence as an independent entity.
*[[1917]] &ndash; The first U.S. troops arrive in France to fight alongside [[United Kingdom|Britain]] and France against Germany in [[World War I]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[World War I]], [[Eastern Front (World War I)|Western Front]]: [[Battle for Belleau Wood]] &ndash; Allied Forces under [[John J. Pershing]] and [[James Harbord]] defeat Imperial German Forces under [[Wilhelm, German Crown Prince]].
*[[1924]] &ndash; American occupying forces leave the [[Dominican Republic]].
*[[1927]] &ndash; [[The Cyclone]] roller coaster opens on [[Coney Island]].
*[[1934]] &ndash; President [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] signs the [[Federal Credit Union Act]], which establishes credit unions.
*[[1936]] &ndash; Initial flight of the [[Focke-Wulf Fw 61]], the first practical helicopter.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: Under the [[Molotov-Ribbentrop Pact]], the [[Soviet Union]] presents an [[June 1940 Soviet Ultimatum|ultimatum]] to [[Romania]] requiring it to cede [[Bessarabia]] and the northern part of [[Bukovina]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; World War II: Soviet planes [[Košice attack|bomb Kassa, Hungary]] (now [[Košice]], [[Slovakia]]), giving Hungary the impetus to declare war the next day.
*[[1942]] &ndash; The first flight of the [[Grumman]] [[F6F Hellcat]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: The [[Battle of Osuchy]] in [[Osuchy]], [[Poland]], ends with the defeat of the [[Polish resistance movement in World War II|Polish resistance forces]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; The [[United Nations Charter]] is signed in San Francisco.
*[[1948]] &ndash; The Western allies begin an airlift to Berlin after the [[Soviet Union]] blockades [[West Berlin]].
*  1948   &ndash; [[William Shockley]] files the original patent for the [[grown junction transistor]], the first [[bipolar junction transistor]].
*  1948   &ndash; [[Shirley Jackson]]'s short story ''[[The Lottery]]'' is published in ''[[The New Yorker]]'' magazine.
*[[1952]] &ndash; The [[Pan-Malayan Labour Party]] is founded in [[Federation of Malaya|Malaya]], as a union of statewise labour parties.
*[[1953]] &ndash; [[Lavrentiy Beria]], head of [[MVD]], is arrested by [[Nikita Khrushchev]] and other members of the [[Politburo]].
*[[1955]] &ndash; The South African Congress Alliance adopts the [[Freedom Charter]] at the [[Congress of the People (1955)|Congress of the People]] in [[Kliptown]].
*[[1959]] &ndash; The [[Saint Lawrence Seaway]] opens, opening North America's [[Great Lakes (North America)|Great Lakes]] to ocean-going ships.
*[[1960]] &ndash; The former British Protectorate of [[British Somaliland]] gains its independence as [[Somaliland]]. 
*  1960   &ndash; [[Madagascar]] gains its independence from France.
*[[1963]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[John F. Kennedy]] gave his "[[Ich bin ein Berliner]]" speech, underlining the support of the [[United States]] for democratic [[West Germany]] shortly after [[Soviet Union|Soviet]]-supported [[East Germany]] erected the [[Berlin Wall]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; At [[Plesetsk Cosmodrome]] nine people are killed in an explosion of a Cosmos 3-M rocket.
*[[1974]] &ndash; The [[Universal Product Code]] is scanned for the first time to sell a package of Wrigley's [[chewing gum]] at the Marsh Supermarket in Troy, Ohio
*  1975   &ndash; Two [[FBI]] agents and a member of the [[American Indian Movement]] are killed in a shootout on the [[Pine Ridge Indian Reservation]] in [[South Dakota]]; [[Leonard Peltier]] is later convicted of the murders in a controversial trial.
*[[1977]] &ndash; The [[Yorkshire Ripper]] kills 16 year old shop assistant Jayne MacDonald in [[Leeds]], changing public perception of the killer as she is the first victim who is not a [[prostitute]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; [[Air Canada Flight 189]] to Toronto overruns the runway and crashes into the [[Etobicoke Creek]] [[ravine]]. Two of 107 passengers on board perish.
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Ten-Day War]]: The Yugoslav people's army begins the Ten-Day War in [[Slovenia]].
*[[1995]] &ndash; [[Hamad bin Khalifa al-Thani]] deposes his father [[Khalifa bin Hamad al-Thani]], the [[Emir]] of [[Qatar]], in a bloodless [[coup]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; The [[Supreme Court of the United States|U.S. Supreme Court]] rules that the [[Communications Decency Act]] violates the [[First Amendment to the United States Constitution]].
*[[2000]] &ndash; [[Bill Clinton|President Clinton]] announces the completion of the first survey of the entire [[human genome]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; The [[Supreme Court of the United States|U.S. Supreme Court]] rules in ''[[Lawrence v. Texas]]'' that gender-based [[sodomy law]]s are unconstitutional.
*[[2006]] &ndash; [[Mari Alkatiri]], the first [[Prime Minister of East Timor]], resigns after weeks of political unrest.
*[[2012]] &ndash; The [[Waldo Canyon Fire]] descends into the Mountain Shadows neighborhood in [[Colorado Springs, Colorado|Colorado Springs]] burning 347 homes in a matter of hours and killing two people.
*[[2013]] &ndash; The [[Supreme Court of the United States|U.S. Supreme Court]] [[United States v. Windsor|rules]] that Section 3 of the [[Defense of Marriage Act]] is unconstitutional and in violation of the [[Fifth Amendment to the United States Constitution|Fifth Amendment]] to the [[United States Constitution]]. 
*  2013   &ndash; [[June 2013 Shanshan riots|Riots]] in [[China]]'s [[Xinjiang]] region kill at least 36 people and injuring 21 others.
